required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Non-Invasive Neuromodulation Device for Prevention of Episodic Migraine Headache
clinical_study.official_title: A Non-Invasive Neuromodulation Device for Prevention of Episodic Migraine Headache

brief_summary.textblock: This study will assess the efficacy of a neuromodulation device for the treatment of episodic migraine headache.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is a multi-center, triple-blinded, placebo-controlled, randomized clinical trial for adjunctive prophylactic treatment of episodic migraine headache (with or without aura) using neuromodulation device developed by Scion NeuroStim, LLC (SNS). The investigational use of the device for episodic migraine headache has been reviewed by the FDA and is classified as NSR (non-significant risk).

clinical_study.why_stopped: Inability to supply and maintain treatment device. No safety concerns occurred.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month of baseline recordation followed by 84 days of device use
primary_outcome.description: comparison of MHD recorded in baseline month versus 3rd month of treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Normalized Reduction in Migraine Headache Days
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month of baseline recordation followed by 84 days of device use
secondary_outcome.description: comparison of MHD recorded in baseline month versus 3rd month of treatment: percentages, active versus placebo

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month of baseline recordation followed by 84 days of device use
secondary_outcome.description: reduction in acute, prescribed medications in month 3 of treatment versus baseline month

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month of baseline recordation followed by 84 days of device use
secondary_outcome.description: reduction in subject perceived headache pain scores in month 3 of treatment versus baseline month

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month of baseline recordation followed by 84 days of device use
secondary_outcome.description: comparison of HIT-6 (headache impact test) scores between baseline month and treatment month 3

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month of baseline recordation followed by 84 days of device use
secondary_outcome.description: comparison of BDI-II (Beck depression index) scores between baseline month and treatment month 3

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month of baseline recordation followed by 84 days of device use

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month of baseline recordation followed by 168 days of device use
secondary_outcome.description: comparison of MHD recorded in baseline month versus 6th month of treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Sustained Reduction in Migraine Headache Days
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month of baseline recordation followed by 252 days of device use
secondary_outcome.description: comparison of MHD recorded in baseline month versus post-treatment months 7, 8 and 9

intervention.intervention_name: active neuromodulation for episodic migraine headache
intervention.description: Non-invasive brainstem neuromodulator. Active and placebo devices appear identical

intervention.intervention_name: placebo neuromodulation for episodic migraine headache
intervention.description: Sham non-invasive brainstem neuromodulator. Active and placebo devices appear identical

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- diagnosed with episodic migraine at least 6 months before study
- at least 3 consecutive months of stable migraine headaches before study
- at least 4-14 headache days per month, of which 4-14 may be migraines
- must not have failed on more than 2 classes of migraine preventatives
Exclusion Criteria:
- previous use of the experimental device
- pregnant
- using more than 1 concurrent migraine preventive
- history of cardiovascular disease
- work night shifts
- diagnosed with vestibular migraine
- menstrual migraines exclusively
- diagnosed with post-traumatic migraine
- have a history of unstable mood or anxiety disorder
- use a hearing aid
- have a cochlear implant
- have chronic tinnitus
- have temporomandibular joint disease
- diagnosed with traumatic brain injury
- diagnosed with neurological disease other than headaches
- diagnosed vestibular and/or balance dysfunction
- history of abusing alcohol or other drugs
- are experiencing medication overuse headaches
- have had eye surgery in the previous 3 months
- have had ear surgery in the previous 6 months
- have active ear infections or a perforated tympanic membrane
- have participated in another clinical trial in the last 30 days
- are currently participating in another clinical trial
- using Botulinum toxin-based treatments for migraines or cosmetic reasons
- taking anti-emetics more than 2 times per week (consistently)

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: BID Placebo
group.description: Participants self-administered twice-daily inactive/sham treatments for 12 weeks (treatment period 1) followed by twice-daily active treatments for 12 weeks (treatment period 2) followed by a post-treatment observation period lasting 12 weeks (observation period).

group.title: BID Active
group.description: Participants self-administered twice-daily active treatments for 12 weeks (treatment period 1) followed by twice-daily active treatments for an additional 12 weeks (treatment period 2) followed by a post-treatment observation period lasting 12 weeks (observation period).

group.title: QD Active
group.description: Participants self-administered once-daily active treatments for 12 weeks (treatment period 1) followed by once-daily active treatments for an additional 12 weeks (treatment period 2) followed by a post-treatment observation period lasting 12 weeks (observation period).

group.title: BID Placebo
group.description: Participants self-administered twice-daily inactive/sham treatments for 12 weeks followed by twice-daily active treatments for 12 weeks followed by a post-treatment observation period lasting 12 months.

group.title: BID Active
group.description: Participants self-administered twice-daily treatments for 12 weeks followed by twice-daily active treatments for an additional 12 weeks followed by a post-treatment observation period lasting 12 months.

group.title: QD Active
group.description: Participants self-administered once-daily treatments for 12 weeks followed by once-daily active treatments for an additional 12 weeks followed by a post-treatment observation period lasting 12 months.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

measure.title: Monthly migraine days
measure.description: Monthly migraine days within the 28 day baseline according to an electronic daily diary.

outcome.title: Change in Migraine Headache Days (MHD)
outcome.description: comparison of MHD recorded in baseline month versus 3rd month of treatment
outcome.time_frame: 1 month of baseline recordation followed by 84 days of device use
outcome.population: The majority of devices failed in the field, preferentially affecting the active arm/group. As a result, data collection was compromised due to the frequent device failures and thus the results are not reported. No significant device related AE’s were reported over the course of the Study.

event.sub_title: Ear discomfort, itch, irritation, pruritis or fullness

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
